    "name": "Increasing sequence generated by these rules: a(1)=1, and if x is in a then 3x-2 and 3x are in a.",
    "comment": [
        "Examples for various choices of i and k:",
        "A003278:  (i,k)=(-2,-1)",
        "A191106:  (i,k)=(-2,0)",
        "A191107:  (i,k)=(-2,1)",
        "A191108:  (i,k)=(-2,2)",
        "A153775:  (i,k)=(-1,0)",
        "A147991:  (i,k)=(-1,1)",
        "A191109:  (i,k)=(-1,2)",
        "A005836:  (i,k)=(0,1)",
        "A191110:  (i,k)=(0,2)",
        "A132140:  (i,k)=(1,2)",
        "For a=A191106, we have closure properties: the integers in (2+a)/3 comprise a; the integers in a/3 comprise a."
    ],
    "link": [
        "David Garth and Adam Gouge, <a href=\"https://cs.uwaterloo.ca/journals/JIS/VOL10/Garth/garth14.html\">Affinely Self-Generating Sets and Morphisms</a>, Journal of Integer Sequences, 10 (2007) 1-13."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = 2*A005836(n) + 1. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 06 2011",
        "a(n) = A005823(n) + 1. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Dec 17 2012"
    ],
    "example": [
        "1 -> 3 -> 7,9 -> 19,21,25,27 -> ..."
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "h = 3; i = -2; j = 3; k = 0; f = 1; g = 9;",
        "a = Union[Flatten[NestList[{h # + i, j # + k} &, f, g]]]  (* A191106; regarding g, see note at A190803 *)",
        "b = (a + 2)/3; c = a/3; r = Range[1, 900];",
        "d = Intersection[b, r](* illustrates closure property *)",
        "e = Intersection[c, r](* illustrates closure property *)"
    ],
